meanings.definition: A person who holds property or an office for a certain period of time.
meanings.sent1: The tenours of the house will change next month.
meanings.sent2: The tenours of the land are responsible for its maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The tenours of the office threw a surprise party for their successor.
meanings.sent4: The tenours of the throne must always be prepared for challenges.
meanings.sent5: The tenours of the contract were clearly outlined in the agreement.

meanings.definition: The act of holding or occupying something.
meanings.sent1: His tenours of the trophy were firm and proud.
meanings.sent2: The tenours of the seat were contested by many candidates.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tenours of the box were comically possessive.
meanings.sent4: Her tenours of the spotlight made her a natural performer.
meanings.sent5: The tree's tenours of the sunlight created a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: The main theme or idea in a piece of writing or speech.
meanings.sent1: The tenours of the story revolved around friendship.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the tenours of the speech required careful listening.
meanings.sent3: The tenours of the play were unexpectedly humorous.
meanings.sent4: The tenours of the poem painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The tenours of the novel captured the essence of adventure and discovery.
